page.title: 08Businesses in Southwick
page.content: The village is served by a{General {Store cum Post Office}that sells groceries, confectionery, tobacco and alcohol. Southwick is graced by two public houses, the Red Lion which is owned by Gales Ales and the Golden Lion - a free house and{a brewery.}The brewing has only restarted in the last couple of months and was featured in the regional news on television. The brewery closed in l957 when the master brewer{'Old Dick Olding'}retired. The brewery was sold to Courage but fell into disuse, now however it is a working museum, viewed by appointment. It is financed partly by the County, a brewery and MSC and is run by volunteers.
